text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Midi-Pyrénées | native_name = | native_name_lang = fr | settlement_type = Region of France | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_flag = Flag of Midi-Pyrénées.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_shield = Arms of Languedoc.svg | shield_size = | image_blank_emblem = | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Midi-Pyrénées in France.svg | map_caption = | motto = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | extinct_title = Dissolved | extinct_date = 1 January 2016 | seat_type = Prefecture | seat = Toulouse | parts_type = Departments | parts_style = list | parts = 8 | p1 = Ariège | p2 = Aveyron | p3 = Haute-Garonne | p4 = Gers | p5 = Lot | p6 = Hautes-Pyrénées | p7 = Tarn | p8 = Tarn-et-Garonne | leader_party = PS | leader_title = President | leader_name = Martin Malvy | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 45348 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 2926592 | population_as_of = 1 January 2012 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | blank_name_sec1 = GDP (2012) | blank_info_sec1 = Ranked 8th | blank1_name_sec1 = Total | blank1_info_sec1 = €79.9 billion (US$102.7 bn) | blank2_name_sec1 = Per capita | blank2_info_sec1 = €27,198 (US$34,982) | blank_name_sec2 = NUTS Region | blank_info_sec2 = FR6 | website = Midi-Pyrenees Region | iso_code = FR-N | footnotes = }} Midi-Pyrénées ( or Mieidia-Pirenèus) is a former administrative region of France. It is now part of the administrative region of Occitanie. It is part of the historical region of Occitania. The name of the region is not based on any old name, like in most other regions, but on the geography of the region, Midi (meaning "southern France") - Pyrénées (Pyrenees mountains that are the highest mountains in the region). The French adjective and name of the people living in the region is Midi-Pyrénéen. The departments in the region were Ariège, Aveyron, Haute-Garonne, Gers, Lot, Hautes-Pyrénées, Tarn, and Tarn-et-Garonne. Its capital was Toulouse. ==Geography== The Midi-Pyrénées region is the largest region of Metropolitan France. It had an area of . It bordered to the south with Spain and Andorra. It also bordered four French regions: Aquitaine to the west, Limousin to the north, Auvergne to the northeast and Languedoc-Roussillon to the east. The region can be divided into three landscape zones: * The south is dominated by the high mountains of the Pyrenees. * The north-east and the north are part of the highlands of the Massif Central * The central and north-western parts of the region, however, are flat. This zone is dominated by the Garonne river and its tributaries, which drains most of the region to the Atlantic Ocean. The Pic Vignemale (), at , is the highest point of the Midi-Pyrénées region; it is on the border with Spain. The Vignemale is in the Pyrénées National Park. The main rivers of the region are the Garonne river, that flows through the Haute-Garonne, Hautes-Pyrénées and Tarn-et-Garonne departments; and the Adour river, that flows through the Hautes-Pyrénées and Gers departments. ==Departments== The Midi-Pyrénées region was formed by eight departments: Département Préfecture ISO 3166-2 Population (2012) Area (km²) Density (Inh./km²) Ariège Foix FR-09 152,366 4,890 Aveyron Rodez FR-12 276,229 8,735 Haute-Garonne Toulouse FR-31 1,279,349 6,309 Gers Auch FR-32 189,530 6,257 Lot Cahors FR-46 174,346 5,217 Hautes-Pyrénées Tarbes FR-65 228,854 4,464 Tarn Albi FR-81 378,947 5,758 Tarn-et-Garonne Montauban FR-82 246,971 3,718 ==Demographics== In 2012, The Midi-Pyrénées region had a population of 2,926,592. Its population density was inhabitants/km2. The 10 most important cities in the region were: City Population (2012) Départment Toulouse 453,317 Haute-Garonne Montauban 56,887 Tarn-et- Garonne Albi 49,231 Tarn Tarbes 41,664 Hautes-Pyrénées Castres 41,529 Tarn Colomiers 36,699 Haute-Garonne Tournefeuille 26,342 Haute-Garonne Muret 24,492 Haute-Garonne Rodez 23,744 Aveyron Blagnac 22,983 Haute-Garonne ==Gallery== File:Massif de Tabe 280.jpg|Massif of Tabe, Ariège File:Vioulou2.jpg|Vioulou stream, Aveyron File:FR-32-Landscape6.JPG|Sunflowers in Gers File:Le Salat à Roquefort-sur-Garonne 1.jpg|Salat river, Haute-Garonne File:Lac du Milieu de Bastan Hautes Pyrénées 02 BLS.JPG|Middle Lake of Bastan, Hautes-Pyrénées File:Le Lot Cahors 2.jpg|Lot river in Lot (Albi) Cité épiscopale d'Albi - Le palais de la Berbie et la cathédrale Ste Cécile.jpg|Albi, Tarn File:Montauban - le Pont Vieux.jpg|Montauban, Tarn-et-Garonne ==References== ==Other websites== * Regional Council of Midi-Pyrénées official website * france.fr - Official website of France * About-France.com: MIDI-PYRENEES - a short guide Category:Former administrative regions of France
